website_summaries.verdict: Fairly inexpensive, easy to install, and easier to operate, this straightforward model from TRAC works surprisingly well for its low price.
pros: Simple push button operation raises or lowers anchor
cons: You will need to directly press the buttons on this model because there isn’t a remote control option

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing! So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on a Lowe Sea Nymp 1457. Using a 15lb mushroom anchor. I absolutely love it. Put it on the front and also installed the remote kit. I am well pleased. I've had it out about 4 times now and the convenience is just something. I can sit it the rear and drop the front anchor without moving my lazy rear end. Hopefully it will last. Works exactly as described. Bought another to install on rear to accommodate complete laziness. Don't expect it to reel in faster than what is claims to do. 8/16/18 update: Still working like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: lainfrost23

customer_reviews.title: Beats hand cranking
customer_reviews.text: I added this to my 13-foot fishing boat and use a 15-pound river anchor. And I installed a second up-down switch at the helm. Nice to have an electric in place of the hand crank I had before. Works well overall, but would have liked it better if the anchor did a free fall on the way down. It winds down at the same speed that it winds up, so it is taking longer to set the anchor now. But glad to have it and I am using the anchor a lot more now when I fish.
customer_reviews.author: James Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Install this way
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. If you Attach both units together. Be sure to bolt down the main unit to the boat first then mount the small unit to the boat then bolt both units together in that order .
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Unit in pieces
customer_reviews.text: This unit was received with parts all over the box. They were all included but not assembled. I was going to return it but decided to assemble and test it out. Everything works perfectly we will see how it does over time. This my second unit, the first one arrived assembled. So far, highly recommend. Steve G
customer_reviews.author: SteveGord

customer_reviews.title: Anchor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about two years ago now. Have not had any issues whatsoever. The installation went smoothly and it works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: VilRuS

customer_reviews.title: Very unreliable product.
customer_reviews.text: Very unreliable. Worked fine at first then would not work the next day. Worked sporadically for 2 days and then quit altogether while I was on the lake. I hade to pull anchor up manually. I sent it back. Amazon did give me a full refund in just a couple of days. I had an older model that lasted years but it seemed to be made much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I SHOULD HAVE READ THE REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: SWITCH FAILED ON SECOND RUN. LUCKY AMAZON GETS YOU A NEW ONE IN TWO DAYS, THOUGH THE REAL PROBLEM IS THE TIME INVOLVED IN INSTALLING ANOTHER ONE. THE NEXT ONE BETTER LAST LONGER THAN TWO MINUTES OR I WILL GIVE UP AND BUY ANOTHER BRAND.
customer_reviews.author: rw miller

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The up and down button wears out fast. Company will keep sending you a new part but it just wears out again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Largen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product 👍
customer_reviews.text: Really a great awesome products use it many a times on my boat camping trips fishing trips I love how fast I can get my anchors up and back down
customer_reviews.author: William G Scott Sr

customer_reviews.title: They have 2 different 25 models
customer_reviews.text: This unit will not work with the wireless remote control. Even though it’s the model 25. Be sure to look closely I feel like it’s a bait and switch deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It depends on the write boat if it is easy .
customer_reviews.text: The power switch is two small of wire to do it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan pantry

customer_reviews.title: Quality control missing.
customer_reviews.text: When winch came it would not work. Heard some rattling inside and took off cover only to find out some screws had been left out because of stripped threads. Had to retap some holes and find new bolts to repair item. After repair it works ok.
customer_reviews.author: Thurman Jaggers

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described and was very easy to install. It makes things very easy and saves time when on the water with my boat.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney T.

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Goes fast but running a 15 pound anchor
customer_reviews.author: Larry D.

customer_reviews.title: Wife is happy:)
customer_reviews.text: Couple of fasteners missing, but was able to find replacements in my junk. Plan ahead and allow time, these are not quick mounts especially on uneven or services of different materials. Had to modify bolts to long screws on one of the two I mounted, due to no access on bottom. They work and I think I will be satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Holloway

customer_reviews.title: trac t10108
customer_reviews.text: Had to modify to fit my boat. seems to work ok in the river,a little weak pulling up.You only need one remote switch not both that is sujested.Wireless switch is not what is pictured but works fine. ok for the money.also it is a discontinued product not made any more.
customer_reviews.author: RONALD HANSEN

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Not as described.
customer_reviews.text: Not as described. Barely pulled up a 16.5 anchor while testing out of water. Could only imagine what would happen out on water. Too bad I already drilled holes in boat to mount. Returning for refund. Thought about getting the 45 but reviews appear to be the same. Lesson learned. Now I have to pay shipping to return it. But on the brightside seller will refund my money. Save your money. Don't buy one.
customer_reviews.author: W.C.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: We returned this as it wouldn't work for the anchor we have.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E. Noon

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but not the most "macho"
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this on my boat, but don't expect a robust response when reeling in the anchor. A little bit of mud or a few weeds wrapped on the anchor will slow the retrieve to a crawl.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Q. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: not good for bass boats
customer_reviews.text: would have worked out great if i had a pontoon or a V hull with a plate up front. not recommended for a fiberglass bass boat.
customer_reviews.author: sledhead

customer_reviews.title: Mounting was very easy, came with all the wiring and connections
customer_reviews.text: Mounting was very easy, came with all the wiring and connections, just need a battery. Used several times and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mounting holes location
customer_reviews.text: The old one and the new one had different mounting holes, meaning I had to drill more holes in my boat to mount it. Other than that, I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus Barron

customer_reviews.title: Super deal!
customer_reviews.text: Husband was well pleased. We haven't been able to try it out yet, we have ice on the lake. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare to install
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have any cuss words in your vocabulary you will after trying to install this item. Mounting holes are in an almost inaccessible location. Had to do a little disassembly to access one of the holes which was another nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: TopG

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't perfom well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago. It was slow but beats pulling up by hand. Then I got deeper than 10 feet. After about 10 feet of depth the overloads kick out ever 5 feet or so. This means that you have to wait on the overloads to cool before it will operate again. this isn't acceptable operation in my opinion. A thread on a website suggested that my battery was not charged enough or too small. I bought three 35 amp hr, glass matt batteries and a trickle charger. I wired them in series. It should have had enough power to pull a barge, but still no improvement in performance. I'm taking it out and installing a hand crank.
customer_reviews.author: Jace Brown

customer_reviews.title: Don't let it get wet
customer_reviews.text: Had on 17 ft skiff, went out one morning and anchor laying on ground and motor burned up, believe rain got in switch and shorted it on and burned motor up.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Trac 25 anchor winch, it's just so so.
customer_reviews.text: had this winch for a couple of years now it has quite a bit of rust on the metal base, it didn't really go up and down as fast as I would liked it to. It just died on me a few days ago and I replaced it with a Minn Kota much better unit, much more sturdy,much faster movement. by the way the Minn Kota was a deckhand 40 that I have now.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE W

customer_reviews.title: Used 4 times the 2nd time out sounded like the motor was full of rocks only got worse
customer_reviews.text: Junk!!! Used 4 times the 2nd time out sounded like the motor was full of rocks only got worse. 4th time out the winch got wet and started to pull up the anchor. I had to cut the wires to get it to stop. 2nd trip it also lost power. Had a hard time pulling the anchor out of the mud. 10lbs anchor as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very poor
customer_reviews.text: The anchor works good if it's working. I have had it for 3 years, and had to replace the switch every year. Now the control module is bad, and good luck getting parts. I would never purchase this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

product_meta.title: Trac Outdoors Fisherman 25-G3 Electric Anchor Winch - Anchors Up to 25 lb. - Includes 100-feet of Pre-Wound Anchor Rope with Use (69002)
product_meta.description: Fisherman 25 Electric Anchor Winch Fisherman 25 Electric Anchor Winch will power up and down your anchor with anti-reverse internal clutch to prevent free-spooling. The model comes in Fresh Water and Salt Water finishes. The Salt Water Model include additional corrosion protection, added UV inhibitors and stainless steel hardware. Specifications Maximum Anchor Capacity: 20-25 lbs. Typical Boat Length: up to 20′ Speed up: 65 ft/min Speed down: 70 ft/min Separate roller davit included Winch Dimensions (LxWxH): 10″ x 9.75″ x 5.75″ Davit Dimensions (LxWxH): 9.5″ x 3.5″ x 5″ All Anchor Winch models include: Rugged All-Steel Gears 100’ of 0.20” pre-wound braided anchor rope Automatic resetting circuit breaker Sealed membrane UP/DOWN switch 14-gauge marine-grade battery wire, 17 ft long Anchor safety chain Assembly hardware and instructions. Due to size/weight there may be additional shipping charges outside of the contiguous USA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars72 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
